programme.desc: Baseball heroes Roger Maris and Mickey Mantle attempt to break the legendary Babe Ruth's record 60 home runs in a single season _ will they accomplish the daunting task? Drama, directed by Billy Crystal, starring Joe Buck, Dane Northcutt, Charles Esten and Scott Connell Billy Crystal - Director Thomas Jane - Mickey Mantle Barry Pepper - Roger Maris Anthony Michael Hall - Whitey Ford Richard Masur - Milt Kahn Bruce McGill - Ralph Houk Thomas Jane - Mickey Mantle Barry Pepper - Roger Maris Anthony Michael Hall - Whitey Ford Richard Masur - Milt Kahn Bruce McGill - Ralph Houk.

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Drama starring Clint Eastwood. Retired car-assembly worker, widower, Korean War veteran and all-round curmudgeon Walt Kowalski is thrown into conflict with his Hmong neighbours after one of the teenage sons tries to steal his prize 1972 Ford Gran Torino as part of a gang initiation rite Clint Eastwood - Director Clint Eastwood - Walt Kowalski Bee Vang - Thao Ahney Her - Sue Christopher Carley - Father Janovich Brian Haley - Mitch Kowalski Geraldine Hughes - Karen Kowalski Brian Howe - Steve Kowalski Dreama Walker - Ashley Kowalski William Hill - Tim Kennedy John Carroll Lynch - Barber Martin Brooke Chia Thao - Vu Chee Thao - Grandma Clint Eastwood - Walt Kowalski Bee Vang - Thao Ahney Her - Sue Christopher Carley - Father Janovich Brian Haley - Mitch Kowalski Geraldine Hughes - Karen Kowalski Brian Howe - Steve Kowalski Dreama Walker - Ashley Kowalski William Hill - Tim Kennedy John Carroll Lynch - Barber Martin Brooke Chia Thao - Vu Chee Thao - Grandma.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Drama, Sci Fi, Horror ║ 2004 ║ 12

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: Historical drama starring Frank Langella and Michael Sheen. For three years after leaving the White House in disgrace following the Watergate scandal, former US President Richard Nixon has remained silent on the matter. So when talk-show host David Frost persuades Nixon to agree to a series of televised interviews, it is the perfect opportunity for the British TV star to make a name for himself. But Nixon has his own reasons for taking part, and the resulting confrontation will go down in television history Ron Howard - Director Frank Langella - Richard Nixon Michael Sheen - David Frost Kevin Bacon - Jack Brennan Rebecca Hall - Caroline Cushing Toby Jones - Swifty Lazar Matthew Macfadyen - John Birt Oliver Platt - Bob Zelnick Sam Rockwell - James Reston Jr Clint Howard - Lloyd Davis Patty McCormack - Pat Nixon Frank Langella - Richard Nixon Michael Sheen - David Frost Kevin Bacon - Jack Brennan Rebecca Hall - Caroline Cushing Toby Jones - Swifty Lazar Matthew Macfadyen - John Birt Oliver Platt - Bob Zelnick Sam Rockwell - James Reston Jr Clint Howard - Lloyd Davis Patty McCormack - Pat Nixon.

programme.title: State of Play
programme.desc: Crime thriller starring Russell Crowe and Ben Affleck, based on Paul Abbott's award-winning television series. When congressman Stephen Collins breaks down at a press conference following the suspicious death of his researcher Sonia Baker, press speculation goes into overdrive. Reporter Cal McAffrey, assigned to the story because he is an old friend of Collins, soon uncovers a web of intrigue Kevin Macdonald - Director Russell Crowe - Cal McAffrey Ben Affleck - Stephen Collins Rachel McAdams - Della Frye Helen Mirren - Cameron Lynne Robin Wright - Anne Collins Jason Bateman - Dominic Foy Jeff Daniels - George Fergus Michael Berresse - Robert Bingham Harry Lennix - Detective Bell Wendy Makkena - Greer Thornton Russell Crowe - Cal McAffrey Ben Affleck - Stephen Collins Rachel McAdams - Della Frye Helen Mirren - Cameron Lynne Robin Wright - Anne Collins Jason Bateman - Dominic Foy Jeff Daniels - George Fergus Michael Berresse - Robert Bingham Harry Lennix - Detective Bell Wendy Makkena - Greer Thornton.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.sub-title: Documentary And Factual, War, Drama, Action, History ║ 2001 ║ 15
programme.desc: War drama based on real events, starring Josh Hartnett, Ewan McGregor and Tom Sizemore. On 3 October 1993, elite US troops were sent into Somalia's capital, Mogadishu, to capture two lieutenants working for the local warlord responsible for orchestrating a famine in the region. The ensuing 15-hour battle saw the deaths of nearly 20 American soldiers, and hundreds of Somalis, after two Black Hawk helicopters were shot down Ridley Scott - Director Josh Hartnett - Ranger Staff Sgt Matt Eversmann Ewan McGregor - Ranger Spec Grimes Tom Sizemore - Ranger Lt Col Danny McKnight Eric Bana - Delta Sgt First Class \Hoot\ Gibson William Fichtner - Delta Sgt First Class Jeff Sanderson Ewen Bremner - Specialist Shawn Nelson Sam Shepard - Maj Gen William F Garrison Gabriel Casseus - Ranger Spec Mike Kurth Kim Coates - Delta Master Sgt Chris \Wex\ Wexler Hugh Dancy - Ranger Sgt First Class Kurt Schmid Ron Eldard - Chief Warrant Officer Mike Durant Ioan Gruffudd - Ranger Beales Jeremy Piven - Chief Warrant Officer Cliff Wolcott Brendan Sexton III - Ranger Private First Class Richard Kowalewski Jason Isaacs - Captain Mike Steele Orlando Bloom - Private First Class Todd Blackburn Zeljko Ivanek - Harrell Glenn Morshower - Matthews Tom Hardy - Twombly Carmine Giovinazzo - Goodale Matthew Marsden - Sizemore Treva Etienne - Firimbi Ty Burrell - Wilkinson Josh Hartnett - Ranger Staff Sgt Matt Eversmann Ewan McGregor - Ranger Spec Grimes Tom Sizemore - Ranger Lt Col Danny McKnight Eric Bana - Delta Sgt First Class \Hoot\ Gibson William Fichtner - Delta Sgt First Class Jeff Sanderson Ewen Bremner - Specialist Shawn Nelson Sam Shepard - Maj Gen William F Garrison Gabriel Casseus - Ranger Spec Mike Kurth Kim Coates - Delta Master Sgt Chris \Wex\ Wexler Hugh Dancy - Ranger Sgt First Class Kurt Schmid Ron Eldard - Chief Warrant Officer Mike Durant Ioan Gruffudd - Ranger Beales Jeremy Piven - Chief Warrant Officer Cliff Wolcott Brendan Sexton III - Ranger Private First Class Richard Kowalewski Jason Isaacs - Captain Mike Steele Orlando Bloom - Private First Class Todd Blackburn Zeljko Ivanek - Harrell Glenn Morshower - Matthews Tom Hardy - Twombly Carmine Giovinazzo - Goodale Matthew Marsden - Sizemore Treva Etienne - Firimbi Ty Burrell - Wilkinson.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc: Action thriller sequel starring Lucas Black. To avoid jail for illegal street racing, a bad-boy teenager is sent to Japan to stay with his estranged father. programme.title: Miami Vice

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Constance Wu, Henry Golding and Michelle Yeoh. New Yorker Rachel Chu travels to Singapore with her partner, Nick, for a friend's wedding, and discovers that Nick's family is hugely wealthy. They also expect him to remain in Singapore to inherit their hotel business - a plan that, as Nick's imperious mother Eleanor makes quite clear, does not involve Rachel Jon M Chu - Director Constance Wu - Rachel Chu Henry Golding - Nick Young Michelle Yeoh - Eleanor Young Gemma Chan - Astrid Young Teo Lisa Lu - Ah Ma Awkwafina - Peik Lin Goh Ken Jeong - Wye Mun Goh Sonoya Mizuno - Araminta Lee Chris Pang - Colin Khoo Constance Wu - Rachel Chu Henry Golding - Nick Young Michelle Yeoh - Eleanor Young Gemma Chan - Astrid Young Teo Lisa Lu - Ah Ma Awkwafina - Peik Lin Goh Ken Jeong - Wye Mun Goh Sonoya Mizuno - Araminta Lee Chris Pang - Colin Khoo.

programme.title: Sing

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs the World
programme.desc: Action comedy from the director of Shaun of the Dead, starring Michael Cera and Mary Elizabeth Winstead. Despite having a high-school girlfriend, wannabe rock star Scott Pilgrim can't help falling for the woman of his dreams, the enigmatic Ramona Flowers. programme.title: Game Night
programme.desc: Comedy mystery starring Jason Bateman and Rachel McAdams. An extremely competitive, board game-loving couple get to test their skills when one of their group is "kidnapped" during an interactive role-play. programme.title: Inferno
programme.sub-title: Action, Mystery, Thriller, Drama, Crime/detective, Arts And Culture ║ 2016 ║ 12
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on the bestseller by Dan Brown, starring Tom Hanks and Felicity Jones. Renowned symbologist Dr Robert Langdon wakes up in a Florence hospital with a head injury and no memory of the previous 48 hours. However, he soon finds himself hunted and forced to undertake a globe-trotting race against time to prevent the release of a deadly virus capable of killing half the world's population Ron Howard - Director Tom Hanks - Robert Langdon Felicity Jones - Dr Sienna Brooks Irfan Khan - Harry Sims, \The Provost Omar Sy - Christoph Bouchard Ben Foster (1) - Bertrand Zobrist Sidse Babett Knudsen - Dr Elizabeth Sinskey Ana Ularu - Vayentha Ida Darvish - Marta Paul Ritter - Arbogast Tom Hanks - Robert Langdon Felicity Jones - Dr Sienna Brooks Irfan Khan - Harry Sims, \The Provost Omar Sy - Christoph Bouchard Ben Foster (1) - Bertrand Zobrist Sidse Babett Knudsen - Dr Elizabeth Sinskey Ana Ularu - Vayentha Ida Darvish - Marta Paul Ritter - Arbogast.

programme.desc: The fourth instalment of JK Rowling's fantasy adventure franchise starring Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson and Ralph Fiennes. But when tragedy strikes, Harry fears the worst.

programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.sub-title: Drama, Animation, Children's, Comedy, Family, Fantasy ║ 2024 ║ U
programme.desc: Santa Claus is excitedly preparing for another busy festive season at the North Pole with his army of helpers, including executive assistant Leo. Can tech-savvy tyke Billie and a robot companion restore Santa's memory before a megalomaniacal businessman takes undeserved ownership of Yuletide? programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince Of Thieves
programme.desc: Kevin Costner is the hero leading a peasant revolt against the evil Sheriff of Nottingham (Alan Rickman). Stirring adventure with Morgan Freeman. Strong language/violence. (1991)(138 mins).

programme.title: The Equalizer 3
programme.desc: In Italy, Robert McCall protects his new friends by taking on the mafia. Action thriller starring Denzel Washington. (2023)(105 mins).

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: While rival pilot Val Kilmer battles to become dogfighting ace, hotshot Tom Cruise romances tutor Kelly McGillis. Classic action. (1986)(106 mins).

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: Bradley Cooper takes on the role of Chris Kyle, the deadliest marksman in US military history. Oscar-nominated biopic from director Clint Eastwood. (2014)(127 mins).

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: Swordsman Jet Li competes in a series of visually stunning, action-packed battles as he recounts his defeat of three fearsome warriors. In Chinese with English subtitles. (2002)(96 mins).

programme.title: Hudson Hawk (1991)
programme.desc: Eccentric billionaire Richard E Grant forces suave cat burglar Bruce Willis to steal Leonardo Da Vinci's most valuable works. Barmy comedy caper. (1991)(96 mins).

programme.title: Swordfish
programme.desc: Explosive hi-tech action with villainous John Travolta using ace hacker Hugh Jackman to steal billions of dollars. Strong language/violence/sex/flashing images. (2001)(100 mins).

programme.title: Djokovic v Federer 2015
programme.desc: In the final of the 2015 US Open, Novak Djokovic battled past Roger Federer to secure his second title at Flushing Meadows, and a 10th Grand Slam overall for the Serb.

programme.title: Vinci v Serena 2015
programme.desc: After winning the first three majors of the year, Serena Williams' pursuit of the Calendar Grand Slam ran into an unseeded Roberta Vinci in the semi-final of the 2015 US Open.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: In the Halle final, world number one Jannik Sinner comes up against 2022 winner Hubert Hurkacz. (23.06).

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Jack Draper goes for his first ATP Tour title as the Brit competes in the Stuttgart final against a former Wimbledon finalist and two-time champion here, Matteo Berrettini. (16.06).

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1981 Bitesize
programme.desc: A look at Bjorn Borg's swansong, as the Swede came up against long-standing rival John McEnroe in the 1981 US Open men's singles final.

programme.title: Alcaraz v Ruud 2022
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz and Casper Ruud went toe to toe in the final of the men's singles at the 2022 US Open. With the Arthur Ashe stage set, both players were going for a first career Grand Slam.

programme.title: Swiatek v Jabeur 2022
programme.desc: The moment the 21-year-old Pole secured her second major of the year, Iga Swiatek defeated Tunisia's Ons Jabeur in straight sets in the final of the women's singles at the 2022 US Open.

programme.title: Laver v Roche 1969
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 1969 US Open, history was made, as Rod Laver became the only man in the Open Era to win the Calendar Grand Slam - owning all four majors in the same year.

programme.title: US Open: Draper v Zhang
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper takes to the court for a first-round encounter with 27-year-old Zhizhen Zhang of China at the 2024 US Open.

programme.title: US Open: Draper v Diaz
programme.desc: Jack Draper's US Open adventure continues with a second-round clash against Argentine Facundo Diaz Acosta. Draper's campaign began with victory in round one over Zhizhen Zhang.

programme.title: US Open:Draper v Van De Zandschulp
programme.desc: Jack Draper appears on Grandstand as Botic van de Zandschulp - the man who shocked Carlos Alcaraz - stands between the 22-year-old Briton and a place in the US Open last 16.

programme.title: US Open: Draper v Machac
programme.desc: Jack Draper's bid for a first Grand Slam quarter-final sees the British number one challenge Tomas Machac. Draper has matched last year's fourth-round run at Flushing Meadows.

programme.title: US Open: Draper v De Minaur
programme.desc: In Jack Draper's first Grand Slam quarter-final, the 22-year-old British number one competes with Australia's Alex de Minaur, who is targeting a maiden major semi-final appearance.

programme.title: US Open: Draper v Sinner
programme.desc: Jack Draper's big moment arrives on Arthur Ashe Stadium as the British number one competes in his first Grand Slam semi-final against the world number one, Jannik Sinner of Italy.

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Highlights
programme.desc: Revisit one of the standout matches from yesterday's action at the Next Gen ATP Finals.

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Highlights
programme.desc: Revisit one of the standout matches from yesterday's action at the Next Gen ATP Finals.

programme.title: LIVE: Tennis: ATP Next Gen Final
programme.desc: A singles champion is crowned at the Next Gen ATP Finals, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Previous winners of this event include Grand Slam winners Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz. (22.12).

programme.title: WTA Finals: Riyadh Final
programme.desc: At the WTA Finals in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, a women's singles champion is crowned. (09.11).

programme.title: ATP Finals: Turin Final
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned as world number one Jannik Sinner faces familiar foe American Taylor Fritz at the 2024 Nitto ATP Finals. (17.11).

programme.title: Jack Draper's US Open

programme.title: Pakistan v England 1st Test Hlts
programme.desc: England's three-Test tour of Pakistan begins with day one in Multan against Shan Masood's men, as Brendon McCullum's red-ball outfit set out to replicate 2022's 3-0 whitewash. (07.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 1st Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day two of the opening Test between Pakistan and England in Multan. Centuries from Shan Masood and Abdullah Shafique see Pakistan resume play on 328 for four. (08.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 1st Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day three of England's opening Test match of three against Pakistan in Multan. The tourists resume play on 96 for one in reply to Pakistan's mammoth score of 556 all out. (09.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 1st Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day four of the first Test in Multan. England's new leading run-scorer in Test cricket Joe Root returns to the crease as the tourists close in on Pakistan's total of 556 all out. (10.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 1st Test Hlts
programme.desc: An 86-over record partnership of 454 between England's Joe Root and Harry Brook has the tourists on the brink of a memorable win, as Pakistan trail by 115 runs on day five. (11.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 2nd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day one of the second Test between Pakistan and England in Multan. The opener saw the tourists defeat the hosts in extraordinary fashion, winning by an innings and 47 runs. (15.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 2nd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Pakistan resume day two of the second Test in Multan on 259 for five. In place of Babar Azam, debutant Kamran Ghulam hit a century before being removed by England's Shoaib Bashir. (16.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 2nd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day three of the second Test between Pakistan and England. A pivotal final session yesterday saw momentum shift the way of the hosts, as England resume play on 239 for six. (17.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 2nd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day four of the second Test between Pakistan and England. After a rampant Pakistan display, the tourists have a winning target set at 297 to turn their fortunes around in Multan. (18.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 3rd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Rawalpindi stages the third and final Test match, as Pakistan and England enter day one of the decider with the series all square following the hosts' 152-run win in Multan. (24.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 3rd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day two of the third and final Test match between Pakistan and England in Rawalpindi. Pakistan resume play on 73 for three in reply to England's Jamie Smith-inspired total of 266. (25.10).

programme.title: Pakistan v England 3rd Test Hlts
programme.desc: Day three of the third Test between Pakistan and England in Rawalpindi. Trailing by 53 runs, England resume play on 24 for three in reply to Pakistan's 77-run first-innings lead. (26.10).

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro 20:A.Villa v ManCity
programme.desc: Relive the 2019-20 Carabao Cup final as Aston Villa and Manchester City went head-to-head at Wembley. City were looking for a third consecutive trophy in this competition.

programme.title: Jimmy Glass: The Great Escape
programme.desc: 20 years on from Carlisle's remarkable escape from relegation, take a look back at one of football's most extraordinary events. Hear from Jimmy Glass, captain David Brightwell and others.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: Derby County v Leeds
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Derby County take on Marcelo Bielsa's Leeds United at Pride Park in a Championship match that saw five goals.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: West Brom v Leeds Utd
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, West Brom take on Leeds United at The Hawthorns in a high-scoring Championship match that saw one side dominate.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: A. Villa v Birmingham
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Aston Villa host Birmingham City at Villa Park in a high-scoring Second City derby.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: Aston Villa v N. Forest
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Aston Villa host Nottingham Forest at Villa Park in an enthralling, end-to-end encounter that saw 10 goals.

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Aston Villa v Leeds Utd
programme.desc: In the dying embers of an 2018-19 Sky Bet Championship clash at Villa Park, Kemar Roofe's last-gasp goal sealed a famous Leeds comeback having trailed 2-0 to Aston Villa.

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Aston Villa v Sheff Utd
programme.desc: In 2019 at Villa Park, Tyrone Mings, Tammy Abraham and Andre Green saved Villa's blushes, scoring three goals in the final 10 minutes to steal a point from the visiting Sheffield United.

programme.title: EFL Cup 08/09: Man Utd v Tottenham
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 Carling Cup final at Wembley Stadium. Manchester United and Tottenham battled for the trophy in a game that went all the way to penalties.

programme.title: Scottish Premiership Goals 2022/23
programme.desc: Enjoy a compilation of some of the best goals scored throughout the 2022-23 Scottish Premiership campaign.

programme.title: Scottish Premiership Goals 2023/24
programme.desc: Enjoy a compilation of some of the best goals scored throughout the 2023-24 Scottish Premiership campaign.

programme.title: EFL Play-Off Final: C'Ship 21/22
programme.desc: After 46 games and a two-legged semi-final, it all comes down to this - the Sky Bet Championship Play-Off Final. One place remains in the Premier League, will it be Huddersfield or Forest?

programme.title: EFL Play-Off Final: League 1 21/22
programme.desc: After a long, gruelling Sky Bet League 1 campaign - the play-off final has arrived at Wembley Stadium. Will it be Sunderland or Wycombe who secure promotion to the Championship?

programme.title: EFL Play-Off Final: League 2 21/22
programme.desc: Promotion awaits as Mansfield Town take on Port Vale in the Sky Bet League 2 Play-Off final at Wembley. Who will secure their place next season in England's third tier?

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Charlton v Doncaster
programme.desc: Two matches of Sky Bet League 1 semi-final play-off action couldn't separate Charlton Athletic and Doncaster Rovers in 2019, as a date at Wembley hinged on a dramatic penalty shootout.

programme.title: EFL 21/22: Coventry City v Fulham
